definition: to show the wolf into the house (idiom)/to introduce a potential source of trouble

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
wolf/CL:匹[pi3],隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy
surname Shi

sentences.english: I know I'll set a fox to keep the geese if I take him for a good friend.
sentences.chinese: 我知道要是把他當好朋友的話，等於引狼入室了。

sentences.english: Most people have a daily fight to keep the wolf from the door.
sentences.chinese: 許多人每天都在奮鬥，以免引狼入室。

sentences.english: Inviting terrorists to take part in the talks has created a hostage to fortune.
sentences.chinese: 邀請恐怖組織參加會談是引狼入室。

sentences.english: Tadatoki helpless, please come to counter-insurgency Gaochang soldiers, surprise, surprise it is asking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 忠節無奈，請高昌兵前來平亂，想不到卻是引狼入室。

sentences.english: The Kevin's do lead the wolf into the house.
sentences.chinese: 凱文一家真是引狼入室了。

sentences.english: Asking for his help means setting the wolf the keep the sheep.
sentences.chinese: 向他尋求幫助就是引狼入室。

definition: lit. to nurture a tiger invites calamity/fig. to indulge one's enemy is asking for trouble (idiom)
leaving the door open invites the thief (idiom); to invite disaster by giving evildoers a free hand
lit. a lamb in a tiger's den (idiom)/fig. to tread dangerous ground
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
ambition of wild wolves (idiom); rapacious designs
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: to dig one's own grave
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
lit. to let the tiger return to the mountain; fig. to store up future calamities
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
Rear a tiger and court disaster. (idiom); fig. if you're too lenient with sb, he will damage you later/to cherish a snake in one's bosom
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to take advantage of sb's misfortune/to loot
see 窩裡鬥|窝里斗[wo1 li5 dou4]
